docs.text: Some helper functions. Mostly clones of rstats functions.
docs.title: Home

docs.text: rstats clone functions rrep A clone of rstats rep Parameters: x ( [type] ) – [description] times ( int ) – [description]. Defaults to 1. each ( int ) – [description]. Defaults to 1. length_out ( [type] ) – [description]. Defaults to None. Returns: [type] – [description] Examples: pyjsta.rrep([1,2,3], 2, 1) rtable A clone of rstats table https://stackoverflow.com/a/43096495/3362993 Parameters: a : a list (or list-like object) Examples: pyjsta.rtable([1,2,3]) table functions plotly_table View or print a pandas DataFrame as a plotly table Parameters: df ( [type] ) – [description] pdf_path ( [type] ) – [description]. Defaults to None. Returns: [type] – [description] Examples: import pandas as pd # hgt = 400 # wth = hgt * 1.55 df = pd.DataFrame(zip(["0.01544"], ["d"]), columns = ["b", "c"]) pyjsta.plotly_table(df, col_format = [".2f", ""]) md_table View or print a pandas DataFrame as a markdown table Parameters: df ( [type] ) – [description] pdf_path ( [type] ) – [description] Examples: import pandas as pd df = pd.DataFrame(zip(["a"], ["d"]), columns = ["b", "c"]) pyjsta.md_table(df, "test.pdf")
docs.title: API

docs.text: A clone of rstats rep Parameters: x ( [type] ) – [description] times ( int ) – [description]. Defaults to 1. each ( int ) – [description]. Defaults to 1. length_out ( [type] ) – [description]. Defaults to None. Returns: [type] – [description] Examples: pyjsta.rrep([1,2,3], 2, 1)
docs.title: rrep

docs.text: A clone of rstats table https://stackoverflow.com/a/43096495/3362993 Parameters: a : a list (or list-like object) Examples: pyjsta.rtable([1,2,3])
docs.title: rtable

docs.text: View or print a pandas DataFrame as a plotly table Parameters: df ( [type] ) – [description] pdf_path ( [type] ) – [description]. Defaults to None. Returns: [type] – [description] Examples: import pandas as pd # hgt = 400 # wth = hgt * 1.55 df = pd.DataFrame(zip(["0.01544"], ["d"]), columns = ["b", "c"]) pyjsta.plotly_table(df, col_format = [".2f", ""])
docs.title: plotly_table

docs.text: View or print a pandas DataFrame as a markdown table Parameters: df ( [type] ) – [description] pdf_path ( [type] ) – [description] Examples: import pandas as pd df = pd.DataFrame(zip(["a"], ["d"]), columns = ["b", "c"]) pyjsta.md_table(df, "test.pdf")
